xxl.core.functions
Class DecoratorFunction<P,R>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.functions.Function<P,R>
      xxl.core.functions.DecoratorFunction<P,R>
Type Parameters:
P - the type of the function's parameters.
R - the return type of the function.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
CountingFunction, For, MetaDataFunction, Swapper
public class DecoratorFunction<P,R>
extends Function<P,R>

A decorator-function decorates (wraps) a function by passing given arguments to the invoke method of the wrapped function. To enhance the functionality of a function just inherit from this class and override the method of your choice.

See Also:
Serialized Form

DecoratorFunction

public DecoratorFunction()
Constructs a new decorator-function without a function to decorate. This constuctor is only used by classes inherited from this class providing an enhanced functionality.

Note: Do not use this constructor by calling it directly.

compose

public <T> Function<T,R> compose(Function<? super T,? extends P>... functions)
This method declares a new function h by composing a number of functions f_1,...,f_n with this function g.

Note that the method does not execute the code of the new function h. The invocation of the composed function h is just triggered by a call of its own invoke-method. Then, the input parameters are passed to each given function f_1,...,f_n, and the returned objects are used as the input parameters of the new function h. The invoke method of h returns the final result.

Overrides:
compose in class Function<P,R>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of the composed function's parameters.
Parameters:
functions - the functions to be concatenated with this function.
Returns:
the result of the composition.

getFunction

public Function<? super P,R> getFunction()
Returns the decorated function.

Returns:
the decorated function.
